title: Tiniest issue ever
body:
Using macs2 v2.1.4 (default install from bioconda in my case), I get an output file of 31 header lines, instead of the 29 described in the user guide. This causes the error:

> Use of uninitialized value within @columnsOriginal in negation (-) at /home/teamgreenberg/bin/RECAP/RECAP.pl line 255.
> Argument "+log10(pvalue)" isn't numeric in exponentiation (**) at /home/teamgreenberg/bin/RECAP/RECAP.pl line 255.

I believe this is because RECAP, when run with -e 29 on a 31 line header file, is using a header row to readjust p-values
Not really an issue, just changed the run parameter from -e 29 to -e 31. 

For any new users, to find out how many header lines your version of macs2 outputs, simply run macs2 using default parameters and open the "xxx_peaks.xls" file in Excel/Libre Office and count the number of header rows. INCLUDE the row that begins with "chr start end..."

Looking forward to using RECAP!
Julien
